turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Lapidaria margaretae.
turn.2: Lapidaria margaretae Lapidaria is a monotypic genus of dwarf succulent plants in the Aizoaceae family.
turn.4: The only species it contains is Lapidaria margaretae, also known as the Karoo rose.
turn.5: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.6: "Lapidaria margaretae" resembles those genera within the Aizoaceae family to which it is most closely related; namely "Lithops", "Dinteranthus" and "Schwantesia".
turn.7: What are the differences between them?
turn.8: However, while "Lithops" and "Dinteranthus" will typically only have one pair of leaves, "L. margaretae" has two to four pairs of leaves.
turn.10: Each leaf is 1.5–2 cm long and 1 cm wide.
turn.12: Clumps of up to three heads may be formed with age.
